results.title: No pain, no mess
results.creator_credit: Simon Target and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Academy”.
Six weeks into their training and its getting tough for some. Laura is having problems sleeping and trying to survive on four hours sleep a night. The cadets are coming up to their first parade and also their first visit with friends and family since joining ADFA. The third year cadets are on a tour of Gallipoli where they come to terms with the reality of war and loss of life, they also participate in the annual soccer match against Turkey; a match Australia has never won.

results.title: No other wealth
results.creator_credit: Bert Nicholas, Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Throughout Victoria, vast areas of land are ravaged by soil erosion, costing the community 6 million dollars each year. The film shows how the Soil Conservation Authority combats erosion by developing methods to stabilize blowing sands with cereal crops; by demonstrating to farmers, methods of contour farming and terracing on sloping country; by reclaiming land ruined by tunnel erosion, and by providing protective cover on reclaimed country.

results.title: No other way
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
The history of the International Labor Organization since World War I. Illustrates two main aspects of its work: the improvement of labor conditions (exemplified by the Maritime labor conventions) and the improvement of living standards. Points out that poverty anwhere is a threat to prosperity everywhere. Shows activities in Libya, where the ILO has helped train workers for new UN assisted industries. Narrated by James McKechnie.

results.title: No other choice
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Impressions of the value and necessity of international cooperation, showing how more advanced countries can help in health, education and economic development of backward and depressed parts of the world. It is argued that cooperation in constructive work and toleration of differences in pursuit of common welfare are the best ways to resolve conflict of national interests. Narrated by Alexander Scourby

results.title: No nukes
results.creator_credit: Julian Schlossberg, Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg and MUSE
results.brief_description: MUSE, (Musicians United for Safe Energy) is a group of musicians and activists working together to put an end to the threat of nuclear weapons and power plants. This video captures one of the many concerts performed by MUSE and takes place at Madison Square Garden in the US in 1980. The “No Nukes Concert” starred Jackson Browne, Crosby, Stills and Nash, The Doobie Brothers, John Hall, Graham Nash, Bonnie Raitt, Gil Scott-Heron, Carly Simon, Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band, James Taylor and Jesse Colin Young and includes among the 20 songs performed “Mockingbird” (James Taylor and Carly Simon), “Running on empty” (Jackson Browne) “Thunder road” and “The River” (Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band. The documentary footage was directed by Barbara Kopple and Haskell Wexler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Schlossberg, Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg and MUSE

results.title: No No, Nonno!
results.brief_description: An award-winning comedy about a displaced Italian grandfather (Nonno), yearning for Naples, but living with his son’s family in suburban Sydney. His only real ally in life is his teenage grandson, Nick, who helps his nonno in a scheme to rescue his old friend, Gennaro, from the Sunnyside Rest Home. (English subtitles)

results.title: No need to stand
results.brief_description: This is the story of a disabled man’s unconventional struggle for rehabilitation. Kwakka is a spruiker at the markets selling goods off the back of his truck. When he becomes a paraplegic after falling off the truck he has to make a new start in life. His girlfriend tries to get him interested in more ‘respectable’ work. Kwakka however has different ideas. An outdoors man at heart, he gets a job selling disability insurance door-to-door. But even this doesn’t satisfy him and soon, despite the objections of his girlfriend, he’s plotting to get back into his old trade - this time in a wheelchair. This amusing drama has some telling points to make about attitudes to disability, and was nominated for Best Screenplay in a Short Film at the 1989 AFI Awards.

results.title: No myth
results.creator_credit: Claire Jager and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: This video exposes the entrenched attitudes and myths surrounding Australia’s most hidden crime: domestic violence. “No Myth” was produced to explain why secrecy, shame and misplaced guilt accompanies domestic violence, and why women who experience it are frequently too scared, ashamed and isolated to confide in anyone.

results.title: No more yesterdays
results.creator_credit: Martin Rolfe, Douglas Warth and British Pathe
results.brief_description: Ireland today - the modern and traditional elements of Irish life with its new industries and consequent prosperity. The changes which are progressive and varied have brought about a “new look” in an old land, improving the living standards of the people while retaining many of the old ways which we associate with Ireland. Commentary by Wilfrid Thomas.

results.title: No more west
results.creator_credit: Nick Grinde, RKO Radio Pictures and Educational Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring comedian Bert Lahr who played the cowardly lion in the Wizard of Oz with Judy Garland. A comic story set in the wild wild west featuring Bert Lahr as the sheriff who finds himself unwittingly facing court for robbing a bank when he was supposed to be out catching the actual bank robbers.
